Reviews.Title: Casio Commando is a rugged beast
Reviews.Author: JT McClure
Reviews.Content: The Phone Body: After having used BlackBerry for a while, I decided to switch to the Droid craze and finally settled on the Commando. If you're searching for a smartphone that looks as rugged as it actually is, then you cant find a better model. It seems the design of the phone incorporated a body that is almost like a protective after market case you see with other phones. It almost eliminates the need to even buy a protective case! The ports, such as the USB charging port and headphone jack have protective plugs that seal off like gas caps to prevent water leaking inside. The battery cover locks and snaps into place VERY TIGHT as well. Almost too tight at times though, which can be frustrating for a quick battery pull. However its a design limitation that sacrifices battery pulls in order to better protect the phone. So it can be a pro or con depending on your outlook. One notable feature I was was surprised by: THE SPEAKERS! These things can put out some good sound! They are actually louder than a few laptops I've used! I've had the volume at full blast before, with lots of sound and almost no crackling or sound distortion! Everything about this phone screams rugged! Keep in mind however rugged DOES NOT MEAN INVINCIBLE. This phone can be damaged, but its made to withstand wear a tear which it has done for me when other phones were already showing signs of wear. Fortunately I've had this phone for a few months now and it still looks as good as the day I got it. Its suffered a few drops, some rain water, and mud, but nothing hard core yet. While it is said that it can take more, I bought mine brand new so Im still playing it safe. To a certain degree you should take care of your phone as much as possible no matter what brand you use.The Touchscreen: The glass is very sleek, smooth coated, and hasnt suffered a single scratch yet. Ive gone months without the screen protector and have yet to actually do damage. I would still recommend a screen protector just in case though. In addition, having to switch from a physical keyboard of BlackBerry to touchscreen of Commando was a bit frustrating. It does take getting used to. But thats not really the fault of the Commando. The default keyboard works ok but I would highly recommend getting a keyboard app from Google Play (Google Play is the store at which you will be using to download apps and comes installed on the Operating System). I highly recommend SwiftKey or GO Keyboard, Ive used both and like them the best. GO Keyboard has extra themes and Red Fusion matches the Commandos look perfectly. A nice additional feature, the phone switches from portrait to landscape when you tilt the phone which comes in handy when you need to use both hands. The touchscreen can be a bit wonky, but almost all touchscreens have hiccups no matter what you do. There is occasional ghost touches and unresponsive touches at times, nothing major that really breaks the phone itself however. But another pro this phone has for it is the screen itself is a nice size, not too big to make the phone overly bulky but displays the images with nice resolution and clarity!The OS: As you probably already know, it uses the Droid Operating System. The version on mine seems to run smoothly. Keep in mind the internal specs of the Commando is nothing mind blowing, but it gets the job done. Also keep in mind if its your first time using a smart phone there WILL BE GLITCHES with the OS. I've used multiple smart phones and multiple brands and all have issues from time to time. They are computers and like all computers they have problems. But in comparison, I use my Commando more than I do my laptop, which says alot! I've played a few games and all seemed to work great. I played The Sims and a few other 3d games and had no problems. I use alot of apps, Facebook, YouTube, Netflix...all work great for me on this phone! A neat bonus that comes with the Commando is the addition of GZ Gear. This program incorporates maps, thermometer, star gazer, compass, and more. All of which can be shortcut keyed to any of your multiple home screen panels. This is handy for outdoorsmen who use their phones for navigation, and gives the GPS a bit more usefulness.The Camera/Camcorder: Neither are nothing special but so far they are better than other phones I've used before. One thing I like is the Commando incorporates a flash, which is one thing I can understand why other phones leave out. A cool feature is the ability to use the flash as a flash light at the push of a button. Other phones can do this, but many require a third party app to be installed. But luckily here its included right into the design!Battery Life: Depending on what you use it for, the battery can last a few hours from a full charge. I watched NetFlix for 5 hours straight to test it out and only then was it at the yellow caution and I decided to plug the charger in. Battery life for phones are varied though. My five hours may be only 3 for someone else. It depends on frequency of use and how much you take care of the battery. Ive found it best to just let it drain to the red before even bothering to charge. Constantly using your phone while leaving it charging can decrease the long term life span of the battery.All in all I could go on with all the pros and cons, so with those key points in mind, I love this phone. Its been the best one I've owned to date, and dont look to replace it any time soon!

Reviews.Title: Great phone some flaws
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: The phone is a great price of equipment. I have never had a phone last the full two years before an upgrade. I have put this phone through the wringer. I have dropped it off a three story building had it in a pool, even melted it in the car. The phone just hasn't died. Now as far as the flaws there are a few things that are very frustrating. When talking on the phone you have to hold the screen away from your face cause the sensor is not that great so you always end up hanging up all the time. The battery life is weak but something I can live with. Mine was only 3 g so it was a lot slower as far as the Internet. Apps seem to lock up a lot. And occasionally the phone tends to restart itself which sucks when you need to use it we all know how long these phones take to load. I would say if you are known to be rough on phones like I am or work in a rough environment, I believe this phone will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME phone!
Reviews.Author: S. Campbell "I Love Lucy"
Reviews.Content: This phone is one tough piece of equipment! It has a very durable case, it is very sleek in design and offers amazing features! If you are a nature lover or outdoorsman, this phone is for you! It offers a compass, terrain for walking and more. It is water, shock and dust resistant. It features a screen that is made from the same "glass" the military uses. Wi-Fi certified, Adobe flash enabled & has bluetooth!

Reviews.Title: Rugged enough for two blondes
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I both kill phones on a regular basis but we now have the Casio G'zOne Commando that has been pretty dang durable. Though it does have a hangup that I dislike and that's the micro SDCard tends to slip and I receive a warning that it needs to be reformated or the card has been removed entirely. I tried taping the card to it's proper location but I still receive error warnings. Grant you the error messages are only received when I do a drop kick across the floor, drop it on cement or my favorite and throw it across the room.

Reviews.Title: only phone to last me over a year
Reviews.Author: Cariston Standish
Reviews.Content: all i need is a phone to last and this phone does. had mine for two years now and that's a record for me. not for the tech savvy. it's big, heavy, and has a tiny screen. not a gps. once out of service area the gps is useless. but it makes calls and doesn't break and has a charging dock so all i gotta do is drop it in it's dock and it's charging. for me i will keep this phone till it's dead and then probably buy another. love the charging dock, love the fact that i don't have to worry about getting it wet or dropping it. it has a working compass and it makes calls. that's all i need. only four stars though cause it's heavy and it's a phone

Reviews.Title: Good phone, condition was ok
Reviews.Author: Kaleb
Reviews.Content: I like the phone as I am someone that works around a lot of dust and in my free time I'm usually around a water source. The phone is alright, I downgraded from an iphone so I wasn't expecting much as far as sensitivity and over all looks. The condition it arrived in was a little worse than what was described so that was a little disappointing. Outside of that I am no the kind of person to stay on their phone all day so it works well as a tool.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for 14 year old Grandson
Reviews.Author: John T Hendricks
Reviews.Content: Grandson had an old cellphone (Boulder) which worked okay but the usual story, ALL MY FRIENDS HAVE...and he was the last of the gang without at LEAST a 3G Android...which is what this is. The seller sent us a unit in like new condition. How much dropping it can take we will see, but he promises not to drop this one (his boulder survived two Boy Scout summer camps). The new 4G replacement may be his next quest-to which I will say MAYBE NEXT YEAR. As with most 14 year olds, he will get the Boulder back if he drops, drowns, loans out and lost, or whatever this gift.

Reviews.Title: Great job!!
Reviews.Author: Steve Chase
Reviews.Content: The phone came as promised and fast. What else could a person want. No hastles, no problems. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Connie Guillaume
Reviews.Content: Phone was in excellent condition for a used phone,  this particular phone does not seem to keep a charge as long as I am use to but works for me ok. I will definitely use your services again. Packaged very nicely and sent in timely manner.

Reviews.Title: great phone w right v of droid but battery life eh
Reviews.Author: Devin
Reviews.Content: It's extremely important to get the right version of droid. I saw does of reviews online about the mic not picking up and working only in speaker phone. Not a Casio problem its a droid problem. However since ive got the newer fixed version I love it. Pretty quick and responsive with all the Casio trademark toughness. My only complaint would be the battery life.  If WiFi data and sync are all on it can suck its battery dead in a few hours. I killed it during just an hour long phone call.

Reviews.Title: This phone sucks
Reviews.Author: Dan Lewis
Reviews.Content: Worst phone I have ever owned. Crashes at least once a day and the battery life is almost non-existent. As soon as I am eligible for an upgrade, I will not turn this phone in. Instead I will smash it to pieces with a claw hammer. It is that bad.

Reviews.Title: Tough phone
Reviews.Author: Paula Thomas
Reviews.Content: not as fast as some, but I love it. It is my 3rd one. Tough, just like they say. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Bad problems
Reviews.Author: Shego
Reviews.Content: The battery life is not good, the flash doesnt have a automatic option, the keyboard does not look nice, camera doesnt work without sd card

Reviews.Title: Do not waste your money
Reviews.Author: Jeff Dawson
Reviews.Content: There are far better phones out there than this one. I bought it to replace my pos iPhone, and now I'm missing my iPhone like crazy. It's tough as nails, but slower than two turtles racing. Definitely not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: consider before buying
Reviews.Author: stan
Reviews.Content: I thought people over reacted but they really suck at describing the condition of the phone... it said good condition but it was poor condition! If this wasn't a temp phone until I get my upgrade, I'd be post. Ableast it works But texting is hard to do in this phone.My iPhone 4 was better

Reviews.Title: great for a about a year
Reviews.Author: csfallenrebel
Reviews.Content: great durable phone i throw it all the time, no problems, except for having a ton of preloaded apps (that are impossible to uninstall) for those people that don't want just a durable phone and want all the stuff for that special person who is a hiking, surfing, fitness/astronomer... untill about a year into having it you'll start having software problems and stuff that unless you bought the phone within the first three months of release, its out dated.

Reviews.Title: Worst phone ever
Reviews.Author: Randall
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for little over a year, and I am counting down the days until I can get an upgrade. It is the slowest phone I've ever owned and the programs frequently freeze. I've had to do 3 master resets just to keep the thing functioning and even with anti-virus software, I'll probably have to do another before my contract is done. As soon as I get a new phone, I'm going to attempt to destroy this "indestructible phone".
